files.description: Create the complete `index.html` file. Include: (1) DOCTYPE html and proper HTML5 structure with lang='en'. (2) Meta tags for charset and viewport. (3) Title: 'Interactive Stopwatch App'. (4) Link to 'styles.css' in <head>. (5) Main container div with id='stopwatch-container'. (6) Timer display div with id='timer-display' and child elements for hours, minutes, and seconds. (7) Controls div with id='controls-container' containing start, stop, and reset buttons. (8) Settings panel div with id='settings-panel' for configurable timer settings. (9) Script tag linking 'app.js' before </body>. Use semantic HTML tags.

files.description: Create complete CSS with: (1) CSS reset and box-sizing. (2) Body styling with centered container, background gradient. (3) #stopwatch-container with max-width 400px, padding, white background, border-radius, box-shadow. (4) #timer-display with font-size 48px, text-align center, padding 20px, background #222, color white. (5) #controls-container with display flex, justify-content space-between, padding 10px. (6) Buttons with padding 12px 24px, font-size 16px, border none, cursor pointer, transition 0.3s, hover effect darker. (7) #settings-panel with display flex, flex-direction column, padding 10px. (8) Keyframe animations for smooth transitions and dynamic size/color adjustments.

files.description: Implement full JavaScript: (1) Get DOM references: const timerDisplay = document.getElementById('timer-display'), const startBtn = document.getElementById('start-btn'), const stopBtn = document.getElementById('stop-btn'), const resetBtn = document.getElementById('reset-btn'). (2) Define timer logic: let elapsedTime = 0, let intervalId = null, let isRunning = false. (3) Function startTimer() sets intervalId = setInterval(updateTimer, 1000), isRunning = true. (4) Function stopTimer() clears intervalId, isRunning = false. (5) Function resetTimer() resets elapsedTime = 0, updates timer display. (6) Function updateTimer() increments elapsedTime, updates timer display with formatted hours, minutes, and seconds. (7) Function lapTime() calculates and displays lap time. (8) Add event listeners: startBtn.addEventListener('click', startTimer), stopBtn.addEventListener('click', stopTimer), resetBtn.addEventListener('click', resetTimer). (9) Call updateTimer() initially.

files.description: Create comprehensive README.md with markdown: (1) # Interactive Stopwatch App - Project title. (2) ## Description - Brief explanation of the app. (3) ## Features - Bullet list of all features (start, stop, reset, lap times, display elapsed time, configurable settings). (4) ## How to Run - Instructions: 'Open index.html in any modern browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)'. (5) ## Usage - Step-by-step: Open app, click start button, click lap button to record lap times, click stop button to pause timer, click reset button to reset timer. (6) ## Technologies Used - HTML5, CSS3 (Keyframe Animations), Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+). (7) ## Project Structure - File tree showing all files and their purposes. (8) ## Browser Compatibility - List supported browsers.
